newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - CRA Managed rated hold.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - CRA Managed rated hold.

text.p: -- Dain Bosworth said Friday it initiated coverage of CRA Managed Care Inc with a hold rating.

-- Dain said CRA, a specialty managed-care services company focusing on cost containment for workers' compensation, has above-average potential for earnings growth. It also cited a diversifying revenue base and likely margin expansion.
-- It added that CRA shares have been trading recently at 36.1 times its 1996 earnings estimate of $1.17 a share.
-- CRA shares on Friday rose 3/8 at 42-5/8.

-- "While we believe the premiums to be deserved for (CRA) shares, current levels are significant in the midst of a period of nervous investor sentiment on the broad group of managed-care stocks in general, suggesting some potential for price volatility," Dain said in a report.
-- Dain said investors should use declines in the stock price for buying opportunities.

-- "Should the company deliver new sales substantially ahead of estimates, bring in a series of major account sales enabled by its new (preferred provider organization) ownership, or achieve an acceleration of growth in its auto-injury managed care business, these events would also lend us to be more aggressive on new positions," Dain said.
